title: Buttermilk Bran Muffins
ingredients: ½  cup raisins, chopped nuts or coconut (optional)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350° F. and generously grease muffin tins for 24 muffins tins or use paper baking cups.
Cream the butter with sugar in large bowl.  Stir in the buttermilk and eggs and mix well.  Add the cereal and mix well.  Let the bended batter stand about 5 minutes.

Sift the flour, baking soda, and salt together.  Add the flour mixture to the batter mixing and blending the ingredients well.  Finally, if you’re going to add raisins, nuts or coconut add them and blend them well.  Divide the batter evenly among the prepared tins.
Bake until a toothpick or tester inserted in the centers comes out clean, about 30 minutes.  Serve warm with butter.

Remarks:  This batter can be frozen.  One can blend the batter, make half the amount in muffins and freeze the unused batter for another time.  Thaw the batter in the refrigerator overnight the next time you get hungry for muffins.
Source:  The Cook’s Exchange, Readers’ Best Recipes, Bon Appétit, February 1982.
